instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2610: What is 820-2610? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6258: What is ISL6258? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2008 through 2009.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, exploding caps and glowing transistors on FW
threads.message:
No liquid damage, no power.

Board came in with no power, heat from around <CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP> area.
[LIST]
[*]Left it plugged in for a while to see what burned my fingers, next thing fan spins and <CAPACITOR>C7798</CAPACITOR> pops, fan promptly stops, <TRANSISTOR>Q4260</TRANSISTOR> goes red hot and removes itself from the board (melted solder).
[*]At this point I guess the fireWire is fucked!
[*]Removed <TRANSISTOR>Q4262</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q4261</TRANSISTOR>
[/LIST]
 <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> read 8.4V but schematic says 6V..

Still heat coming from 6258 area, can't tell if it's from the under side or top side of the board.

Will grab some breakfast and probe around. Any ideas with the little info so far please?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, exploding caps and glowing transistors on FW
threads.message: PPBUS should be 8.4V. Also <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> of course!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, exploding caps and glowing transistors on FW
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 12780"]PPBUS should be 8.4V. Also <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> of course![/QUOTE]

Doe!.. Of course.

Many thanks.
